description: From Anglo-Norman cuntesse, Old French contesse, from Latin comitessa. Doublet of contessa.

entries.meaning: The wife of a count or earl.
A woman holding the rank of count or earl in her own right; a female holder of an earldom.
examples: Elizabeth Millicent Leveson-Gower is 24th Countess of Sutherland; her son will be the 25th Earl.
